snippet.description: * Hospital-Acquired (Nosocomial) Infections What Are Nosocomial Infections? Nosocomial infections are infections are acquired in hospitals and other healthcare facilities. snippet.title: Pseudomonas Infections
snippet.description: * Pseudomonas Infections What Are Pseudomonas Infections? Pseudomonas infections are diseases caused by a bacterium from the genus Pseudomonas. The bacteria are found widely in the environment, such as in soil, water, and plants. They usually do not cause infection in health...

snippet.title: 99,000 Americans Die of Healthcare-Aquired Infections Every Year
snippet.description: * 99,000 Americans Die of Healthcare-Aquired Infections Every Year More work needs to be done to combat the problem of infections acquired in hospitals and doctors' offices, which the CDC director calls a 'winnable battle.'...

snippet.title: Germ-Covered Stethoscopes Cause Hospital-Acquired Infections, Study Finds
snippet.description: * Germ-Covered Stethoscopes Cause Hospital-Acquired Infections, Study Finds A new study shows that stethoscopes need to be disinfected between patients to prevent contamination inside the healthcare system.

snippet.title: CDC: We're Buying Time with Antibiotic-Resistant Infections
snippet.description: * CDC: We're Buying Time with Antibiotic-Resistant Infections Despite a decrease in MRSA infection rates, the CDC director says we need to preserve antibiotic effectiveness for the future.

snippet.title: One in 25 Patients Infected at U.S. Hospitals
snippet.description: * One in 25 Patients Infected at U.S. Hospitals The CDC has reported some improvement in preventing deadly infections, though there's still work to be done.

snippet.title: Antibacterial Soaps Encourage MRSA Bacteria to Colonize Your Nose
snippet.description: * Antibacterial Soaps Encourage MRSA Bacteria to Colonize Your Nose Could you be helping a superbug take hold in your nasal secretions?
